items.title: Information Security Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Information Security Analyst at Wikimedia Foundation

Remote | International

Location: San Francisco, CA or Remote

Summary

We are looking for a smart security practitioner with an interest in large scale systems. You understand the importance of testing and documentation, and common pitfalls in developing secure web applications. You must have a passion for the WMF mission. We do (almost) everything publicly, and volunteers can add arbitrary JavaScript to our site. That should both frighten and thrill you.

Privacy is one of the core values of the Wikimedia Foundation and you will be joining the team responsible for providing technical and governance security solutions to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Wikimedia applications. This is your opportunity to participate in and provide security and privacy solutions so together we can create a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.

This is what you will be doing:

  • Review security controls, policies and procedures and provide recommendations for the adaption of new technologies or policies.
  • Conduct internal and external security audits
  • Provide support for security incidents or events
  • Evaluate current organizational risk and threat profile
  • Identify improvement areas and provide organization wide security awareness training.
  • Work with teams to ensure they make safe, compliant, design and architectural decisions
  • Participate in privacy initiatives
  • Participate in operational security initiatives

You’ll need these skills and experience:

  • 5+ years experience as part of an Information Security team
  • CISSP/GIAC
  • Experience in policy creation and enforcement
  • Experience with Threat Modeling and Risk Assessments
  • Experience in Incident Response
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or related field or the equivalent in work related experience

Pluses

  • Wikimedia community experience
  • Interest in/passion for all things open source

The Wikimedia Foundation is…

…the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

Apply for job

items.title: SEO Sales Consultant
items.content:
About Us

Design Your Way LTD is a digital marketing and lead generation start-up company.
We have a small number of websites generating leads, valued between £15,000 -£200,000. We are now looking to extend the SEO branch of our company and looking to hire a full-time sales consultant to outreach for SEO clients.

We are looking for

Self-motivated, experienced, confident, and innovative SEO Sales Consultants who can both prospect and sell local lead generation and SEO services to businesses around the UK.

Although this role is commission only, we are offering 20% of all future profits that you have generated, while the client is still active, even if you leave us. Sign up 10 clients to earn a passive income of £24,000 per year!

Job Description

This is a remote working, sales only role and you do not need to do any of the SEO work yourself.

All you really need to do is follow this process:

1. Approach business owners
2. They sign up,
3. You get paid.
4. Rinse, and repeat.

Simple!

Responsibilities

• Identify, and secure new SEO Clients.
• Maintain and grow relationships between us and the business owners.
• Negotiate a contract between us and clients that is co-beneficial.
• Able to report and mediate between us and the client.
• Able to work 2 - 3 days a week.
• Have a clear and concise strategy to secure clients within a suitable period.

Skills & Knowledge

• Experience outreaching for and acquiring SEO clients.
• Confident approaching businesses.
• Self-motivated with a passion for SEO sales.
• Disciplined with a targeted sales approach.
• Desire to exceed expectations.
• Confident to adapt sales approach via calls, e-mail, and face to face if necessary.

Benefits

• 20% ongoing profits that you have generated paid to you on a monthly basis (even if you leave us!)
• You can fit this into any lifestyle and enjoy a passive income even while you are on holiday!
• Remote working.
• Flexible working hours.
• Opportunity to stay on during future expansion on an improved deal based on performance.

items.title: Content Marketing Professional for an Electric Bike Company
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Content Marketing Professional for an Electric Bike Company

Company: EVELO Electric Bicycle Company

A small but ambitious team is looking for an awesome content marketing professional to help grow existing earned and owned media efforts.

Does this sound like you:

- Do you have an interest in transportation, technology and ways that can get more people to have a more active lifestyle?

- Do you love writing in all shapes and forms and know how to get people’s attention?

- Do you have a couple of years experience working in the content marketing, SEO and/or PR fields under your belt?

- Do you enjoy helping people, solving problems and working as a small, close-knit start-up team where your contributions are valued, appreciated and make an impact?

If the answer is yes, then by all means - keep reading!

=== Who We Are ===

We are EVELO (www.evelo.com), a Seattle-based electric bicycle company that is focused on developing ways to make it easier for people of all ages and fitness levels to lead a more active, healthy lifestyle.

Our headquarters are based in Seattle, although most of our team works remotely from all over the U.S. - including New York, Boston and the Midwest.

We are looking for bright, ambitious individuals who want a job with direct impact and responsibility to join our team. Great work environment, competitive salary, up to 4 weeks of paid vacation, and stock options.

=== What's The Job? ===

The position we're hiring for is: Content Marketing Manager

Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

  • Developing and marketing content - identifying relevant topics, creating the content from scratch, and proactively working to get it maximum exposure. Most of the content would be oriented around cycling, transportation, cities, health, fitness, aging and startups.
  • Collaborating with journalists - developing and pitching story ideas; proactively seeking out opportunities to get the brand in the conversation about transportation, health, cycling and other topics; nurturing relationships with reporters in the sector.
  • Putting together and continually improving website and email copy, as well as writing copy for new landing pages, promotional email campaigns, etc.
  • Tying all content development and marketing efforts with SEO - much of your work will play an impact on our overall SEO efforts, so you’ll be expected to gain a full understanding of our SEO positions and leverage your content marketing efforts to improving them.

=== Who You Are ===

We’re looking for people who are:

  • Communicative, enthusiastic and want to get your hands dirty - we are a small team and are looking for individuals who are willing to wear more than one hat and do what’s necessary to get the job done.
  • Have prior experience in any of these fields is quite helpful: SEO, PR outreach, content marketing.
  • Feel comfortable with doing outreach - whether to journalists, bloggers, or other websites - to get further exposure for your content.
  • Possess a data-driven mindset: you understand that content is only as valuable as our ability to get people to pay attention to it, so you are also willing to pay attention to the data and tweak your approach consistently.
  • Enjoy working remotely and have the ability to set and meet deadlines. Likewise, experience working remotely with tools like Slack, Skype, Google Analytics, Klaviyo & Wordpress is helpful
You need to love what you do, have opinions, work well in a team, and get excited about marketing & growth.

Bonus: a great sense of design & UX, and enough to be dangerous with HTML/CSS.

=== Benefits ===

Work remotely

Competitive salary

Equity after 1 year with the company.

Work in a meaningful industry at a company that improves the lives of their customers.

How to apply:
Please apply only at evelo.workable.com/jobs/784104/candidates/new

About this job

Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager

mathematical-optimization
math
routes

Job description

### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source

items.title: Ghostwriter needed for long-form marketing content
items.content:
Ghostwriter needed for long-form marketing content

Company: Unlimited Commerce LLC
Location: Remote

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Write your very best stuff with a professional content writer published in sites like Entrepreneur, TheNextWeb, and Foundr.

I will give you steady writing work, a proven process that allows you to research each idea and come up with topics that matter. You will be writing content for me, which will be published under my name.

While you won’t get any bylines right now, I will support you so you can produce stuff that will resonate and genuinely help those readers get ahead. I will answer any question you may have and provide feedback so you can become a better writer every time you write an article.

Here’s why you will love working with me:

  • Steady, long-term, reliable freelance retainer.
  • You get to research interesting topics around online marketing, including SEO, content, and email marketing.
  • I’m here to support you in every step of the writing process.
  • Work from anywhere, any hours (I just care that your weekly deadlines are met).
  • Unlimited email contact and support.

It would be great if you have experience with some of these:

  • SaaS
  • Sales
  • Email marketing
  • SEO
  • PR
  • Advertising
  • Online marketing
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Startups
  • Freelancing
  • Web design & development

You’re comfortable working remotely, with steady, ongoing part-time availability (potential to grow into full-time).

My budget is $100 per 1,000 words. Some articles will be short — 500 words —, while others will be longer — around 2,000 words.

Does this sound good? Start by answering following form and I'll get in touch with you.

I look forward to speaking with you.

items.title: Email Marketing Manager
items.content:
Email Marketing Manager at Creative Group

Remote | Part-time

Location: CA-Palo Alto

The Creative Group (TCG) is looking for a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join a R D client of ours in the Palo Alto area. This candidate can work remote, but must reside in the United States of America on a part-time, ongoing basis. This candidate will be assisting them in monitoring automated drip email campaigns using Pardot, optimizing data in their system, generating reports through Salesforce/Pardot and assisting with re-targeting Google Ads. If you are interested in this position, please send an updated resume to camille.wampler@creativegroup.com

At TCG, we’re committed to you from the moment you sign up. We won’t make you work a certain number of hours or fill out piles of paperwork before we commit to you and your professional future. We believe it’s important to spend time with you from the beginning in order to assess your skills, determine your strengths and figure out the type of work you want to do. Our trained staffing professionals understand that you have a real passion for your work and do their best to find opportunities that are the best fit for you. And we don’t stop there. We’re also available to help with your career questions, provide tips on improving your portfolio and acing interviews, and more. Plus, as one of our registered candidates, you’ll have access to thousands of online training courses and books and of course, everything is free and available when you need it.

Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 1.888.846.1668 to learn more about this position.

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

2018 The Creative Group. A Robert Half Company. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.

items.content:
*Company:*
Think GPS and how it revolutionised many industries and organisations from how we order taxi or food or meet friends to how companies manage their fleet and logistics (or military) and how telcos use this data for targeting. The same revolution will happen indoors where we already spend majority of our times. Think smarter airports, malls, hospitals or even cruise ships.

Pointr is a pinoeer technology company building world's indoor location infrastructure. Key facts:
* Live projects in 14 countries
* 35+ head count
* HQ in London, sales office in Dubai, engineering office in Istanbul, and remote team members in Greece, US, Spain, Belarus and Hungary
* Many international awards
* Many international tender wins (even against the likes of Apple, Google, Siemens, DHL and many others)
* Many prestigious clients including Harrods, IKEA, Sainsbury's, Dubai International Airport, London Gatwick Airport and more

*Role:*
* You will be heading up anything marketing at Pointr, ranging from sales collateral, promotional videos to international event participation to PR and social media
* You will work closely with Business Development team for working on collateral and PR
* You will define marketing strategy and report to CEO
* Mainly London based but some travel (especially Europe and North America) will be expected for events
* Full-time role
* You will have libery to hire specialists (eg. video production company, bloggers) as and when needed

*Requirements:*
* Strong marketing background and experience
* Passion for technology and startup environment
* Enthusiasm for b2b / enteprise sales
* Good communication skills, strong command of English
* Medium to Strong experience with design (eg. producing a poster for an event or a graphic for social media)
* Great team player and do'er attitude

*Nice to haves:*
* Additional spoken languages (Spanish, French, Swedish)
* Experience with b2b sales
* Jack of all trades

We work hard (don't expect a slow paced 9-5) and you will take on a challenging role. Equally, it will be rewarding and you will learn and grow.

items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager

Company: Hubstaff

If you’re a talented marketer whose life motto is “always be optimizing,” we’re looking for you to join our growing remote team. Hubstaff is seeking a data-driven digital marketing manager focused on customer acquisition. In this role, you’ll identify and implement growth strategies for an international B2B software brand.

We’re seeking a curious, hardworking professional that can lead a team to results, and jump into projects when needed. Absolutely 100% must be a team player. Bonus points if you’re a Slack fanatic and all-around communication champ. Must love numbers.

Required
  • Must be based in North America

You’ll be a good fit if you’re ever thought:
  • How could we be doing this better?
  • Here’s how we can automate that.
  • Let’s test this.
  • Instagram should go back to a chronological timeline, it’s what users want.
  • We don’t deserve dogs.*

Duties include:
  • Identify and execute marketing automation opportunities
  • Accurately measure performance using our analytics tools
  • Create and test landing pages
  • Develop innovative ways to grow the user base and acquire clients
  • Coordinate and manage team projects
  • Ensure KPI’s are met
  • Not scared of coming up with new ideas
  • Be passionate about finding growth using your area of expertise
  • Able to learn quickly

Preferred 3-5 years of experience should include:
  • Demonstrated finding of new markets
  • Working with integration partners to get listed on directories, newsletters, etc.
  • Working with other SAAS-based businesses on email promotions / discounts
  • Copywriting
  • Writing engaging blog posts and customer updates
  • Working in a SAAS or e-commerce company (inbound marketing, traffic generation, growth hacking)
  • Setting up sales funnels and conversion tracking (Leadpages, Google Analytics)
  • Running effective A/B Testing (vwo.com)
  • Deep understanding of analytics

Perks include:
  • Freedom to work remote from wherever you are
  • Being part of a hardworking, collaborative, and experienced team
  • Joining a fast-growing company
  • Annual retreat in a different country every year
  • Hilarious co-workers from around the world **
  • Growth and development opportunities

* Cats also accepted.
** Personal opinion, but it’s true.

items.content:
Product Support Specialist at ConvertKit

Remote | Freelance | International

TELECOMMUTE

United States

Surge Support Team

Surge On File

DESCRIPTION

We are looking for awesome people to join our Support Team! Our Support team is vital to our engagement strategy. Engaging with customers quickly via onboarding and retention initiatives are vital to the success of ConvertKit. As such, we’re deepening our coverage to produce greater availability and shorter wait times regardless of time zone.

The Company

ConvertKit is a MarTech application that has grown significantly over the past 2 years. We are now serving over 20K customers which include small businesses and creators. Our clients are vibrant and eager to convert their ideas to revenue. We are a 100% remote company which means you can work from anywhere. Although remote, we are a very tight knit team that communicates frequently.

Your Day to Day involves:

  • Handling at minimum 50 cases per day via email or Live Chat.
  • Teaching customers how to use the ConvertKit platform.
  • Communicating with the team via Slack and occasional Zoom video meetings.
  • Attending weekly or monthly team meetings.
  • Working remotely from anywhere in the world!
  • Collaborate with Customer Success, Engineering, Marketing and Product teams..

REQUIREMENTS

What you’ll bring:

  • Ability to commit to 32-40 hours a week.
  • A collaborative mindset.
  • A strong internet connection to ensure availability.
  • Eagerness to learn and stay up to date with technology.
  • Ability to work during high traffic times – weekdays. We’ll consider candidates with all schedules.
  • Great work ethic and efficiency — working fast without sacrificing quality.
  • Good writing and verbal skills (English).
  • Experience with Convertkit, similar platforms or supporting a SaaS product.
  • 1-2 years of product support experience.

BENEFITS

What we can offer:

  • Learning in-depth about ConvertKit, email marketing, blogging and online business as needed
  • $15-20 an hour based on experience with bonus opportunities
  • Flexible schedule
  • Remote work as a contractor
Apply for job

items.title: BuySellAds.com: Marketing Generalist
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

We are looking for an enthusiastic and self-driven Marketer who will be responsible for managing and growing our suite of design and development web properties.

Although each website does have an established workflow and content framework in place, the successful applicant will have the freedom, tools and time to build the brands, improve content-direction, and explore new revenue opportunities.

This completely remote role is a unique opportunity to bring all of your marketing skills together and put them to the test.

Who are we?

BuySellAds helps connect great brands with hard to reach audiences. We’re an adtech company empowering publishers and advertisers to connect more efficiently.

Don’t let the “adtech” part scare you away: our mission is to help publishers better monetize their sites so they can spend their time focusing on what they care about (their content!) rather than selling ads. We leverage our tech to improve the experience for both sides along the way.

We are a fully distributed/remote team, with 45+ people spread out across 30 cities in 6 countries. We connect weekly through a video stand up and talk constantly through Slack. We empower teammates to contribute meaningful results. We largely work around an EST schedule but are flexible.

The Ideal Candidate

  • Will take a publisher-first approach.
  • Will have a problem-solving mentality.
  • Will be naturally self-driven.
  • Will embrace web technologies.
  • Will be results-driven.
  • Will be able to prioritize tasks.
  • Will be able to work without supervision.
  • Will be a team player.
  • Will be great at communicating.
  • Will be eager to learn new skills.
  • Will be meticulous in planning.
  • Will be self-motivated.
  • Will not be afraid to experiment.
  • Will be passionate about design.

Your Responsibilities

  • Organize and provide support to a team of freelance writers, designers, and developers.
  • Plan consistent, fresh content that creative users and readers will love.
  • Assist in the design, creation, and sending of email marketing campaigns.
  • Create and schedule compelling social media content while maintaining best practices.
  • Implement a rock-solid SEO strategy across all sites.
  • Work directly with department managers in support of various business initiatives.
  • Maintain an ongoing dialog with the Sales team, and explore any new business opportunities.
  • Implement a marketing strategy and project management system for growth.
  • Keep track of the latest innovations and trends in the creative industry.
  • Maintain and build upon established business relationships.
  • Track revenue, traffic and SEO targets, and action as needed.
  • Plan and provide project management for any new web properties.
  • Share any new revenue streams and ideas with the team.

We do our best to make the hiring process fair and straightforward: we do an initial meet-and-greet Zoom screen, and follow with a team pairing to make sure our culture makes sense. We move quickly on decisions, and we aim to respond to every applicant and provide feedback where appropriate: even if we aren’t the right fit for each other, we want you to know rather than have to second-guess.

Apply:

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Teramind

 verified
As a Product Marketing Manager at Teramind, you will be responsible for a range of deliverables including market research, go-to-market plans, product positioning, and sales enablement tools for the Teramind platform. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into business benefits is crucial. In your role as a Product Marketing Manager you will lead, influence, and partner closely with product, demand generation, sales, and technical services to drive collaboration and ensure alignment across the organizations. With your experience conducting research you will help us optimize our product fit and competitiveness in the market. The product marketing manager must be the expert in our customers, how they buy and their buying criteria and will transfer that knowledge to others. This is an individual contributor position.

Responsibilities

Qualifications* A strategic, innovative and creative product marketing professional, able to contribute ideas and strategies to further product and marketing demand.* Comfortable with both strategic messaging and hands-on tactical content creation, and problem-solving skills.* Excellent collaborative and communication skills in English, in both verbal and written formats, to compellingly and effectively influence and educate others across multiple mediums.* Track record of success with product marketing roles in B2B organizations, ability to develop and execute a solid product marketing plan in a startup environment* Previous product marketing experience preferably for a B2B technology or SaaS solution, ideally in the security space.* A good to great level of understanding of concepts and technology related to user activity monitoring, user behavior analytics, data loss prevention and similar topics* A self-starter, self-driven and able to work with minimal supervision in a highly distributed, fast-paced team environmentREQUIREMENTS* Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA preferred* Minimum of 3 years experience in a similar role for a SaaS startup

Email your resume to hiring@teramind.co.

items.title: EVELO Electric Bicycle Company: Content Marketing Professional for an Electric Bike Company
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Content Marketing Professional for an Electric Bike Company

Company: EVELO Electric Bicycle Company
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
http://www.evelo.com
A small but ambitious team is looking for an awesome content marketing professional to help grow existing earned and owned media efforts.

Does this sound like you:

- Do you have an interest in transportation, technology and ways that can get more people to have a more active lifestyle?

- Do you love writing in all shapes and forms and know how to get people’s attention?

- Do you have a couple of years experience working in the content marketing, SEO and/or PR fields under your belt?

- Do you enjoy helping people, solving problems and working as a small, close-knit start-up team where your contributions are valued, appreciated and make an impact?

If the answer is yes, then by all means - keep reading!

=== Who We Are ===

We are EVELO (www.evelo.com), a Seattle-based electric bicycle company that is focused on developing ways to make it easier for people of all ages and fitness levels to lead a more active, healthy lifestyle.

Our headquarters are based in Seattle, although most of our team works remotely from all over the U.S. - including New York, Boston and the Midwest.

We are looking for bright, ambitious individuals who want a job with direct impact and responsibility to join our team. Great work environment, competitive salary, up to 4 weeks of paid vacation, and stock options.

=== What's The Job? ===

The position we're hiring for is: Content Marketing Manager

Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

  • Developing and marketing content - identifying relevant topics, creating the content from scratch, and proactively working to get it maximum exposure. Most of the content would be oriented around cycling, transportation, cities, health, fitness, aging and startups.
  • Collaborating with journalists - developing and pitching story ideas; proactively seeking out opportunities to get the brand in the conversation about transportation, health, cycling and other topics; nurturing relationships with reporters in the sector.
  • Putting together and continually improving website and email copy, as well as writing copy for new landing pages, promotional email campaigns, etc.
  • Tying all content development and marketing efforts with SEO - much of your work will play an impact on our overall SEO efforts, so you’ll be expected to gain a full understanding of our SEO positions and leverage your content marketing efforts to improving them.

=== Who You Are ===

We’re looking for people who are:

  • Communicative, enthusiastic and want to get your hands dirty - we are a small team and are looking for individuals who are willing to wear more than one hat and do what’s necessary to get the job done.
  • Have prior experience in any of these fields is quite helpful: SEO, PR outreach, content marketing.
  • Feel comfortable with doing outreach - whether to journalists, bloggers, or other websites - to get further exposure for your content.
  • Possess a data-driven mindset: you understand that content is only as valuable as our ability to get people to pay attention to it, so you are also willing to pay attention to the data and tweak your approach consistently.
  • Enjoy working remotely and have the ability to set and meet deadlines. Likewise, experience working remotely with tools like Slack, Skype, Google Analytics, Klaviyo & Wordpress is helpful
You need to love what you do, have opinions, work well in a team, and get excited about marketing & growth.

Bonus: a great sense of design & UX, and enough to be dangerous with HTML/CSS.

=== Benefits ===

Work remotely

Competitive salary

Equity after 1 year with the company.

Work in a meaningful industry at a company that improves the lives of their customers.

Apply for this position

Please apply only at https://evelo.workable.com/jobs/784104/candidates/new

items.title: Performance Marketing Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=5, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At Midrive, we’re reinventing driving and insurance for the digital generation. The old way of doing things is broken. 53% of learners fail their first test. Of those who pass, 1 in 5 crash in the first 6 months. That’s unacceptable.

Our technology helps learners find top-rated instructors and access pay-as-you-go insurance, so they can pass-first time and ultimately become safer drivers.

Since launch, over 300,000 young people in the UK have used our apps, data and tech to gain their independence. We are growing quickly and are now available in over 100 towns and cities in the UK, expanding to a new one each week.

Founded in 2013, Midrive has raised over £7.5m to date from a respected group of well-connected and supportive investors ‒ including Holiday Extras and Initial Capital. You may have heard about our recent crowdfunding round which was the 4th largest equity fund-raise target in Crowdcube's history.

We’ve recently been named #19 in the Startup 100, the annual ranking of the most game-changing and exciting new businesses launched in the last three years. We were also named ‘Digital Business of the Year’ by the Federation of Small Businesses in 2017.

Want to help us build the future of learner driving and insurance? Then join us!

REQUIREMENTS

We’re looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience of Google Adwords search campaign management, which would be their main focus in their current role. Data driven and methodical in their approach to performance marketing, they would have a proven ability to drive swift improvements in campaign performance.

This is an exciting opportunity to have an impact managing performance marketing for a fast growth startup! The purpose of the role is to drive efficiencies and growth in our performance marketing channels, including Adwords paid search and paid social campaigns.

Role objectives:

  • Build a best-in-class performance optimised paid search strategy.
  • Draw out actionable insights from performance marketing campaign data.
  • Analyse and report on campaign performance, refining CPA and ROI on all campaigns.
  • Plan, execute and report on all performance marketing channel tests and trials.
  • Develop initiatives to scale performance marketing channels in tandem with Midrive’s instructor supply growth across UK postcode areas.
  • Constantly seek out and trial relevant new channels.
  • Ensure all ad copy and creative is optimised to deliver the right message to target audiences, reflecting points of difference, addressing known customer interests and pain points in an engaging way.
  • Work closely with SEO, content and operations teams to share insights from paid performance.

Key skills and experience:

  • In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience managing Google Adwords. This is a required skill that you will be tested on, so only apply if you are confident that you meet this requirement.
  • Working knowledge of Facebook Ads and Google Analytics.
  • Good understanding of audience targeting and remarketing strategies.
  • Practical understanding of attribution modelling.
  • Experience managing large or complex paid performance channel budgets.

About you:

  • You have lived and breathed Adwords campaign management for at least 1-2 years, and are fully up-to-date with every targeting option and campaign management enhancement in the Adwords interface.
  • You may have gained your experience at a digital advertising agency, managing paid search campaigns on Google Adwords, or client-side in a B2C direct response focused business.
  • You find working with data stimulating, and can quickly draw out insights from performance marketing campaign data reports.
  • With a startup mentality, you are self motivated, a problem solver, ambitious, hard working, collaborative, and want to have an impact on business performance.
  • Ability to approach tasks as a team, and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail and a well organised, structured approach to work and the ability to keep projects on track.
  • You speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

BENEFITS

At Midrive, we work hard, so that's why we make sure that we have best facilities to play harder! We have a host of perks: Free coffee and snacks, Wednesdays treats, Happy Hour Thursdays, team yoga sessions, and training/sharing sessions. We also have regular fun social events - recent adventures have included a glamping trip, escape rooms, comedy clubs, and silent discos.

Midrive is simply a great place to work. We have a fantastic team of talented people working on an interesting product they are passionate about, and a friendly, social atmosphere. We're also a dog friendly office! Add to that competitive salaries, pension plan, and other perks, it's clear why we're a top choice.

DIVERSITY

Diversity and inclusion are essential values at Midrive. We know we'll do our best and most impactful work when we feel we're represented and we belong. We're proud to actively recruit and hire talented people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
Senior Security Researcher – Applications at Sonatype

Remote

100% Remote

Product

Full-Time

Sonatype is looking for a passionate, driven and talented Security Researcher to provide high quality security data from researching software vulnerabilities. This high quality security data ensures that our customers are getting maximum value out of our products making them feel like they are part of the Sonatype family. If you are a positive-thinker and problem-solver and believe that customer success and company success go hand-in-hand, this is a great job for you. This position will provide a valuable learning opportunity with great potential to grow your newly started career in cyber-security. Enjoy your job as you work in a fast-paced, flexible, and fun environment, with talented, diverse, and forward-thinking individuals.

What you’ll do:

  • Review, isolate, analyze, and reverse engineer vulnerabilities in open-source software
  • Document attack capabilities
  • Provide detection and remediation guidance
  • Aid in ideas and prototypes for new tooling
  • Collaborate with other team members toward shared product goals
  • Improve Sonatype products by providing valuable security data
  • Work with technology and business team members to define and refine requirements in an agile development environment

Experiences & Skills Required

  • Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Engineering, or related field: or at least four years of related work experience in lieu of a degree
  • 3+ years experience in application security
  • Knowledge of Java, C#, or Javascript
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills and detail oriented
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Knowledge of application security such as the OWASP Top 10 or Sans 25
  • Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

Experience & Skills Plusses

  • Knowledge of different languages such as Python, Ruby, and scripting
  • Knowledge of different operating systems such as *NIX, Windows
  • Application vulnerability assessment or penetration testing experience
  • Knowledge of open source environments like Github

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We’re proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 100,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We’re curious and we’re constantly innovating without fear of failure. We’re attacking a huge and emerging market and we’re looking for remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

Sonatype is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Apply for job

items.content:
SEO Specialist at Instana

Remote

This position will be responsible for optimizing search engine results, both on-site and off-site, as well as, overseeing other digital marketing related tasks. An ability to perform basic edits within WordPress, from both a function and visual standpoint, is preferred, but not mandatory.

Duties

  • Drive Search Engine Optimization and content strategies including generating high-quality, relevant content for varying audiences and managing the end-to-end content creation process
  • Perform ongoing keyword discovery, competitor analysis, and audience research to identify content gaps and opportunities and drive content planning/creation
  • Collaborate and provide guidance to marketing, creative, and content teams to generate content with SEO and search marketing best practices always in mind
  • Distribute and amplify content via Instana web properties, social media, and relevant industry websites and publications
  • Develop, implement, and provide detailed analytics and reporting of our SEO and content efforts
  • Manage keyword rankings including recommending and implementing changes to website, content, linking/link building, and other factors to improve position for target keywords

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field and 2+ years relevant experience in SEO/content marketing (online public relations experience a plus)
  • Proven track record of implementing successful SEO-driven content strategies
  • Passion for digital marketing and staying up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and content marketing
  • Strong knowledge of Search Engine Optimization and the “white hat” way
  • Familiarity with SEO and analytics reporting tools, such as Google Analytics, BrightEdge, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, Ahrefs, etc.
  • Solid understanding of performance marketing, website and conversion optimization, and online customer acquisition
  • Working knowledge of HTML and experience with WordPress CMS Platforms
  • Strong project management and organizational skills demonstrated through ability to think on your feet and manage multiple campaigns with tight deadlines
  • Strong self-motivator with the ability to quickly pick up new skills and learn new tasks
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, and strong attention to detail

About Instana:

As the leading provider of Application Performance Management solutions for containerized microservice applications, Instana applies automation and artificial intelligence to deliver the visibility needed to effectively manage the performance of today’s dynamic applications across the DevOps lifecycle. Founded by Application Monitoring veterans, Instana provides true AI-powered APM to help organizations deliver high performance applications today and in the future. Visit us at https://www.instana.com to learn more.

Apply for job

Hands-on VP of Marketing at FreeBusy

San Francisco, Remote · Cofounder
At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. The way we interact with email has evolved somewhat in the last 20 years, but calendars are stuck in the 90s. The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner. Read More

At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. The way we interact with email has evolved somewhat in the last 20 years, but calendars are stuck in the 90s. The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner.

The main reason for which we plan our day is because time is the most important commodity in the world. Calendars today are good for recording our daily agenda, but they are terrible at coordinating time with others. We’re focusing on coordinating daily life because that’s where tons of value can be added. Join us!

Applied
Apply to FreeBusy

Apply

Job Description

Create and execute and the growth strategy for FreeBusy users and contribute to the shaping of the automated scheduling assistants market.

Skills

What We're Building

Calendar usage grew tremendously in the past few years fueled by adoption of cloud services and mobile devices. Unfortunately, appointments are spread across many services and we are still wasting a lot of time in back-and-forth emails or phone calls. It's often impossible to share real-time availability with others because Outlook and Google Calendar don't work cross-company.

FreeBusy is a scheduling assistant powered by A.I. to coordinate meetings 10x faster with contacts inside and outside your company. You can interact with FreeBusy on the web, smartphone, and desktop, using voice, chat, and email. FreeBusy
works with existing calendars (Google, Office 365, Exchange, iCloud, Outlook.com, etc.) and you can link as many as you have (work, personal, school). Easily share unified availability with business contacts whether they use FreeBusy or not.

Our current focus is to increase enterprise agility when scheduling meetings cross-company. Watch our story https://youtu.be/HobWYI-QYQM

items.content:
CompilerWorks | San Francisco Bay Area | Full-time, remote | $95k-$225k driven by your productivity.

http://www.compilerworks.com/job.html

CompilerWorks is a bespoke compiler company, with our core product centered around compiling on dialect of SQL to execute on a different backend - e.g. would you like to run Oracle PL/SQL on a PostgreSQL database? You can with CompilerWorks.

We are driven to solve interesting engineering problems, for this reason we take on challenges where compilers are useful. Our technology IS truly disruptive.

We are looking for EXPERIENCED developers (our least experienced developer has more than 10 years of experience). Our core development language is Java.

Let us know if you are interested info {at} compilerworks.com

Avaaz | DevOps/IT Support/Product Owner | Remote | Full-time | www.avaaz.org/hiring

* Technology at Avaaz is scaling fast, and we need a DevOps Engineer whose skills connect the worlds of Software Engineers, DBAs, and Systems Administrators. This role will support maintaining and expanding Avaaz’s infrastructure to improve the way our software is developed. * The Technical Project Manager/Online Campaigner is a technical generalist with strong project management, product development, UI/UX expertise and campaigning skills. Duties include supporting weekly online campaigns, training of campaigners in use of our online platform, monitoring email deliverability, technical documentation, tracking and managing small software development projects, and carrying out smaller discrete tech projects such as building web pages or leading the creation of innovative new product.* The Technical Operations Associate/Officer is a technical generalist with strong IT support and system maintenance skills. This position will work with over 100 staff in over 35 countries to ensure the campaigning work of Avaaz happens on reliable, secure systems with maximum mission-serving up-time. Duties include managing operational infrastructure, technical onboarding/offboarding, staff security support and optimizing internal systems for greater efficiency.

items.content:
Visual Marketing Designer at Xapo

Remote | International
  • Design
  • Remote job

Job description

Overview

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world. Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep providing the best quality support to our customers. We’re known for our fast responses to users, positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working solutions to the people who chose to use Xapo’s products and services.

This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere!

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate and work closely with Product Designers, Copywriters, and Product Managers;
  • Design and produce materials for a wide range of projects, including product branding, marketing campaigns, emails, social media, internal communications and merchandise;
  • Collaborate with our designers to define our brand and design system;
  • Help define both the long-term strategy and short-term tactics for product marketing;
  • Create and maintain a visual assets database of images, logos and graphics available for internal and external use;
  • Give and solicit feedback from your team members;
  • Coordinate with outside agencies and printers to complete projects.

Requirements

  • Background in brand design or digital product marketing;
  • Strong portfolio with examples of visual design across many media;
  • 4+ years experience working as a visual or marketing designer;
  • Experience working in-house or as part of an agency;
  • Proficiency in After Effects, Photoshop and Illustrator, although we’re welcome to adopt other tools;
  • Motion graphics and animation skills;
  • Understanding of technical constraints and business goals;
  • Creative, flexible, with great attention to detail and organized;
  • Ability to create unique creative ideas and take them from concept through to completion;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities, while maintaining a positive attitude.

Nice-to-haves

  • Strong illustration skills;
  • Knowledge of product design and strategy;
  • Experience creating, maintaining or working with brand guidelines or design systems;
  • Knowledge in responsive email coding;
  • Experience partnering with engineers to deliver assets;
  • Photography and image retouching skills;
  • Experience in using project management tools like Slack, Jira;
  • Experience working on Figma.
Apply for job

items.title: Performance Marketing Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=5, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

At Midrive, we’re reinventing driving and insurance for the digital generation. The old way of doing things is broken. 53% of learners fail their first test. Of those who pass, 1 in 5 crash in the first 6 months. That’s unacceptable.

Our technology helps learners find top-rated instructors and access pay-as-you-go insurance, so they can pass-first time and ultimately become safer drivers.

Since launch, over 300,000 young people in the UK have used our apps, data and tech to gain their independence. We are growing quickly and are now available in over 100 towns and cities in the UK, expanding to a new one each week.

Founded in 2013, Midrive has raised over £7.5m to date from a respected group of well-connected and supportive investors ‒ including Holiday Extras and Initial Capital. You may have heard about our recent crowdfunding round which was the 4th largest equity fund-raise target in Crowdcube's history.

We’ve recently been named #19 in the Startup 100, the annual ranking of the most game-changing and exciting new businesses launched in the last three years. We were also named ‘Digital Business of the Year’ by the Federation of Small Businesses in 2017.

Want to help us build the future of learner driving and insurance? Then join us!

REQUIREMENTS

We’re looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience of Google Adwords search campaign management, which would be their main focus in their current role. Data driven and methodical in their approach to performance marketing, they would have a proven ability to drive swift improvements in campaign performance.

This is an exciting opportunity to have an impact managing performance marketing for a fast growth startup! The purpose of the role is to drive efficiencies and growth in our performance marketing channels, including Adwords paid search and paid social campaigns.


Role objectives:

*Build a best-in-class performance optimised paid search strategy.
*Draw out actionable insights from performance marketing campaign data.
*Analyse and report on campaign performance, refining CPA and ROI on all campaigns.
*Plan, execute and report on all performance marketing channel tests and trials.
*Develop initiatives to scale performance marketing channels in tandem with Midrive’s instructor supply growth across UK postcode areas.
*Constantly seek out and trial relevant new channels.
*Ensure all ad copy and creative is optimised to deliver the right message to target audiences, reflecting points of difference, addressing known customer interests and pain points in an engaging way.
*Work closely with SEO, content and operations teams to share insights from paid performance.

Key skills and experience:

*In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience managing Google Adwords. This is a required skill that you will be tested on, so only apply if you are confident that you meet this requirement.
*Working knowledge of Facebook Ads and Google Analytics.
*Good understanding of audience targeting and remarketing strategies.
*Practical understanding of attribution modelling.
*Experience managing large or complex paid performance channel budgets.

About you:

*You have lived and breathed Adwords campaign management for at least 1-2 years, and are fully up-to-date with every targeting option and campaign management enhancement in the Adwords interface.
*You may have gained your experience at a digital advertising agency, managing paid search campaigns on Google Adwords, or client-side in a B2C direct response focused business.
*You find working with data stimulating, and can quickly draw out insights from performance marketing campaign data reports.
*With a startup mentality, you are self motivated, a problem solver, ambitious, hard working, collaborative, and want to have an impact on business performance.
*Ability to approach tasks as a team, and work in a fast-paced environment.
*Excellent attention to detail and a well organised, structured approach to work and the ability to keep projects on track.
*You speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

BENEFITS

At Midrive, we work hard, so that's why we make sure that we have best facilities to play harder! We have a host of perks: Free coffee and snacks, Wednesdays treats, Happy Hour Thursdays, team yoga sessions, and training/sharing sessions. We also have regular fun social events - recent adventures have included a glamping trip, escape rooms, comedy clubs, and silent discos.

Midrive is simply a great place to work. We have a fantastic team of talented people working on an interesting product they are passionate about, and a friendly, social atmosphere. We're also a dog friendly office! Add to that competitive salaries, pension plan, and other perks, it's clear why we're a top choice.

DIVERSITY

Diversity and inclusion are essential values at Midrive. We know we'll do our best and most impactful work when we feel we're represented and we belong. We're proud to actively recruit and hire talented people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.content:
Exciting new startup in the process of raising equity funding is looking to bring on a Marketing Manager.

The company is bringing a popular existing game into the 21st century by integrating cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. The role will be part time initially, with the opportunity to be brought on full time. Remote working accepted for the initial stage.

Ideally the candidate will be as follows:
- Has knowledge/interest in the cryptocurrency/blockchain space
- Has the will to play a key role in the success of the company
- Is a self-starter and can work without major supervision
- Experienced in managing different digital marketing campaigns (SEO, Content Marketing, PPC, etc)
- Experienced in coming up with innovative ideas for campaigns
- Experienced in creating visuals for said marketing campaigns (or at least the ideas for said visuals)

On offer is:
- The chance to be part of an exciting company
- The opportunity to work alongside smart, like minded people
- The opportunity to share ideas as a key member of the team
- The opportunity to eventually build your own team

Compensation is negotiable.

Please apply to this role mentioning previous experience, knowledge of crypto, why you think you would be the best person for the role and one thing of your choice which may convince us you are the right person.

German Speaking Help Desk/Service Desk Analyst - Remote working

Client : Global Customer

Location : Remote

Duration : Short term contract

Must be fluent in both English and German language

An exciting opportunity has arisen with a Global client of ours for a German Speaking Help Desk/Service Desk Analyst on a short-term contract basis. This role will be based Remotely.

You will be providing first line support to both European ( German ) and UK clients, resolving queries, some of a technical nature, or logging and transferring (and monitoring to successful conclusion) for more in-depth support.

The German Speaking Help Desk/Service Desk Analyst will be responsible for:

  • Accepting Help Desk, Service Desk requests and calls coming into the IT department from English and German speakers
  • Handling requests in line with SLA's and escalating up to 2nd/3rd line where necessary
  • Provide remote user support
  • Experience of supporting software applications or helpdesk/desktop experience, must have some technology knowledge
  • A thorough understanding of Microsoft Desktop operating system's (XP, Windows 7 and Windows 8)
  • Knowledge of MS server technologies (server 2008, Active Directory, IIS, exchange 2010 and SQL 2012)
  • Excellent communications skills with a customer focussed attitude

Call Centre, help desk or Service Desk experience is essential.

Must be fluent in both English and German language.

Additional key skills:

  • Help Desk or Service Desk support
  • German and English speaking
  • IT hardware and software knowledge

items.content:
APM Product Marketing Manager

Worldwide
Company: Instana

FULL-TIME

Overview

Instana is looking for an experienced product marketer who loves to craft and convey amazing stories which resonate with our target audience. Primary goals include but are not limited to:

  • Increase recognition of the Instana brand
  • Drive awareness and excitement about how Instana’s AI powered application performance monitoring (APM) solution delivers value from SMB to enterprise
  • Improve efficiency and win rate of sales organization through target persona refinement and training

Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Writing compelling and descriptive content that resonates with target personas
  • Recording product videos that showcase the value of Instana
  • Creating and delivering marketing programs that align with stated goals
  • Creating and delivering presentations at corporate events
  • Providing feedback to the product management team on features that align with stated goals

Qualities and qualifications include but are not limited to:

  • Be awesome, seriously
  • Examples of your work (related to the description above) are required
  • You’ll be given the freedom to do amazing things so you’ll need to be an idea person that is also capable of delivering
  • We are a distributed team so you will need to have excellent time management skills with minimal supervision and a home office environment to focus on work
  • Major bonus points if you have solid video editing skills

About Instana:

As the leading provider of Application Performance Management solutions for containerized microservice applications, Instana applies automation and artificial intelligence to deliver the visibility needed to effectively manage the performance of today’s dynamic applications across the DevOps lifecycle. Founded by Application Monitoring veterans, Instana provides true AI-powered APM to help organizations deliver high performance applications today and in the future. Visit us at  to learn more.

Our clients are not constrained by internal or locally available expertise, nor do they need to pay exorbitant fees to consulting firms to hire "generalists". GUILD connects them directly to Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) from all over the country. In select cities, our Growth Partners engage as onsite project managers, and take care of administrative overheads like contracts, milestones and payments.

In a $200Bn consulting industry plagued by high project failures, we offer a one-of-its-kind service which puts our clients in the driver's seat.

items.content:
IT Management Position

Company: Health Revival Products
Headquarters: New York City,NY
Fast-growing B2C internet company with innovative vitamin and health line are looking for an IT Manager to head our tech team.

You’ll manage our front-end and back-end developers as well as QA to make sure our tech works seamlessly and keep our key systems operational. You’ll also work with the CEO and team members to lead the charge on new projects.


Responsibilities:

  • Day-to-day prioritizing, planning and tracking projects

  • Manage and direct 2-4 software developers and QA people

  • Scope new projects based on department needs

  • Design, develop and modify existing backend systems

  • Research cloud software options and provides cost/benefit analysis

  • Evaluate employee performance, set expectations and goals for department and individual staff members, recruit and train staff

  • Work closely with Support to fix bugs and minimize customer loss

  • Test IT systems on a monthly/quarterly basis to ensure up-time

  • Develop operational metrics and ensure department goals are met

 

Required Qualifications:

  • Six years or more of progressive experience in IT

  • At least three years documented supervisory experience of a technical team

  • Understanding of Project Management

  • Great English proficiency as well as PHP/SQL/HTML

  • Expert Understanding of Software Development Process

  • Problem Solving/Analysis of simple and complex business problems with IT solutions

  • Performance Management experience

  • Experience hiring or recruiting contractors to help with projects

Ideal Candidate:

  • Strong knowledge of application development standards

  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of PHP/mySQL and Amazon back servers

  • Ability to coach and mentor development team members

  • Experience in preventing scope creep

  • Skilled in problem solving of technical issues in an application/development environment

  • PMP Certification a plus

  • Ability to communicate effectively with a fully virtual (US based) team

  • Experience with multiple project-related time, resource reporting and tracking tools

  • Willing to get in the weeds and figure things out, even when a system or service is new to you

  • Willing to ensure team can fix bugs even nights or weekends if there are serious problems

  • Striving for operational efficiency and improving/increasing profit

  • Understanding of budgeting for department

  • B2B e-commerce experience

Competitive Pay, work at home, report to CEO.

Please provide resume if you have the required skills to healthrp.jobs@gmail.com.


Apply for this position

Please provide resume if you have the required skills to healthrp.jobs@gmail.com.

items.content:
Marketing Manager

Company: Biteable
Headquarters: Melbourne
https://biteable.com
Hello. Biteable here. We’re looking for a marketing manager to lead our marketing team, define strategy and play a key role in our fast-growing start-up. If you’re into reaching millions and making an impact, then you’re going to want to read this.

All about you

You drive month-on-month growth. And you know what you’re doing because it’s not your first time. You build sales engines that slurp in conversions like your granddad’s old Chevy V8. You fuel them with a big range of channels - like search, content, email, partnerships, content, and community - that you develop and grow yourself.

You bring people together. You’re not necessarily into fireside singalongs, but you know a thing or two about building a team. You know which kind of people you need on your side to get results. And you know how to get them working together. When you build a team, it works in harmony to achieve results.

You like achieving goals. And setting them. You’re into defining and managing the sales goals of your marketing team, and you’re savvy enough to monitor results across all channels, real-time. You’re proactive and reactive, meaning that you set your course based on your goals, while you navigate based on the conditions at hand.

You know a thing or two about everything. You’re well versed in all facets of marketing for tech start-ups and you’re comfortable riffing with everyone from creative to data and engineering. You’re versatile enough to see the value in different approaches and skilled enough to choose what works best.

You’re into experimenting and learning. While you don’t wear a white coat, you’re methodical in your approach to problem-solving and learning. You take nothing for granted and are always trying to find new ways to improve existing approaches or develop new ones. You’re obsessive in a good way.

You love watching videos. You know that video is pretty much the future of everything and you want to be part of the revolution. You’re aware of the impact video is having on marketing, but it feels like a no-brainer because you saw it coming. You’re passionate about high-quality content and you want to see everyone making better videos.

You’re somewhere on this planet. Wherever you’re based, you’re happy to work with teams in Australia and across the globe, and should geography dictate, you don’t mind traveling regularly. You also know a thing or two about Australian colloquialisms and are comfortable with either having your name shortened or lengthened (as convention dictates).

All about the role

Your tasks as Marketing Manager will be defined in collaboration between the Board and you. These are the things we imagine you doing. You might have better ideas.

  • Set traffic and acquisition goals for the marketing team

  • Grow the marketing vision and implement short-term plans

  • Build out an overachieving team with a diverse skill set

  • Communicate goals and results with your team while guiding their growth

  • Manage a monthly marketing budget with a focus on profitability

  • Collaborate with all departments to reach your team’s goals

  • Experiment with new channels and latest tools

  • Step in (when needed) to plug gaps in the team

  • Participate in ‘all hands’ sessions to better understand the customer experience

  • Attend Board meetings as the marketing stakeholder

All about us

We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity.

Since our launch in 2014 we’ve:

  • Created a community of over 3 million users

  • Rendered 3.4 million videos (that’s about 2.4 million minutes back-to-back)

  • Raised $3.9 million in venture capital including a $2.8M round in Jan 2018

We’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with team members scattered around the world. We’re informal, structurally flat and fun to work with. Our biggest teams are engineering and studio. It’s time to grow our marketing team to match.

How to apply

We want you to start soon, so our application process is quick and intense. Start by sending us your CV and a short explanation about why you and Biteable fit together like a horse and carriage. We’ll review it and get back to you quick smart. We’ll then do two rounds of informal interviews. If it feels right for all of us, you’ll be taking the marketing reins at Biteable shortly. Giddy up.


Apply for this position

jobs@biteable.com

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager


Continued


Location: Remote

Do you have a natural curiosity for problem solving and love collaborating with teams? Do you have a talent for keeping things simple and focused and identifying pain points in products and services to help make good products great? Does an entrepreneurial company, team, and environment help you perform at your peak?

About Our Company

A leader in online continuing education for health and education professionals for more than 18 years, continued (a division of Allied Health Media) is comprised of passionate individuals dedicated to providing an unparalleled online learning experience that enhances the lives and careers of the professionals we serve. We are a fast-paced, nimble organization of highly dedicated, professional, and passionate individuals enjoying what we do. We are certified as a great workplace by the independent analysts at Great Place to Work®. Learn more about us at continued.com.

Position Overview

We are seeking a Product Manager to assist in maintaining current products/services and to assist in the development of new products and features based on feedback from our business development manager. This position will work closely with the business development manager, project manager counterparts, business systems analyst, development leads, SMEs and QA engineers to not only define product release requirements, but to ensure current products/services are operating optimally and according to specifications. 

Responsibilities


* Understands and adheres to the overarching continued product vision, strategy, and 5 year rolling roadmap consistent with our overall strategic plan.

* Meets with multi-functional subject matter experts (SMEs) for continuous learning of all aspects of existing product lines (admin capabilities, payment processing, group sales vs. individual sales offerings, etc).

* Assumes day-to-day management and responsibility for existing products and services including product roadmap specifications/implementation.

* Prioritizes and makes definitive decisions on all product maintenance work and ticket backlogs.

* Engages in ongoing user acceptance testing and customer service insights based on customer feedback and needs from our existing product lines.

* Serves as the internal evangelist for all product/service offerings.

* Assists in the development of new products and features by completing product requirements and product development programs; establishing time schedules with team members.




Knowledge and Skill Requirements


* 3+ years experience in web product development required

* Product management experience a plus

* Bachelor's Degree preferred

* Experience with and understanding of project management and product development for multiple web and mobile consumer products

* Experience writing Product Requirement Documents (PRD’s)

* Extremely motivated and detail-oriented, energized by big challenges

* Strong analytical skills - able to provide innovative solutions to complex problems

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

* Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment

* Ability to think ahead and anticipate problems, issues and solutions

* An organized thinker - you carefully plan projects and make detailed lists

* Enjoy collaborating, communicating, and working closely with people from a wide variety of backgrounds

* Love providing the best possible user experience - having a passion motivates you to work tirelessly to help the team deliver the best possible experiences

* Obsessed with simplicity and being able to make data-driven product decisions




Other Requirements


* Ability to work from your home office Mon-Fri, 8a-5p in your time zone

* Travel occasionally for company and department meetings




Performance Measurements

The Product Manager’s success will be measured and evaluated by the following metrics:


* Increase in overall organizational clarity, pace and delivery, expressed in metrics such as timely release of backlog tickets, quality products, customer satisfaction, and overall system performance.

* Management, prioritization and decision-making ability of ongoing development tickets related to the weaknesses and improvement of current products/services.

* Completion of post-product development evaluations from internal and external stakeholders to determine how well results were achieved.




To Apply

We value attention to detail. Applications that fail to follow these simple steps will not be considered. Include a cover letter with your resume. In your cover letter please include 1) an example of a product(s) you currently manage and specific areas where you are contributing successfully to its future development state (any emphasis within the online education industry is a plus); and 2) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

See more jobs at Continued

items.title: Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Route Optimization Engineer


Clevertech


DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

REQUIREMENTS


* You love doing puzzles

* You have serious math skills

* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts

* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping

* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings




BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video

See more jobs at Clevertech
